title: How to Make a Focusing Rail for Macro Photography

steps.headline: Have the tripod head for your focusing rail.
steps.description: You will want something like a ball head that you would attach to a tripod. This is not a quick release attachment. That will not work.

steps.headline: Get your vise.
steps.description: You can find these at your local garden and construction supply store; a place like Lowe's or Home Depot (US). It will be something along the lines of a 4 inch (10.2 cm) vise.

steps.headline: Determine the exact physical center of the vise.
steps.description: This makes it easier to get a 360 degree of movement and improves its range of motion. Mark it with whatever you have for reference.

steps.headline: Drill a hole through the base of the vise.
steps.description: This is where you are going to attach the tripod head.

steps.headline: Fasten your tripod head that you are going to use.
Drill a hole through the base of the vise and through the metal plate on the top.
steps.description: If you need to, take apart the vise.

steps.headline: Be sure that the hole will be big enough for the stud to fit through.
Screw the drill into place.
steps.description: You may want to add some type of metal adhesive. Or, if you are good with tools, use a soldering tool around where the stud meets the metal of the bench top vise. This will provide for a more secure connection than just adhesive.

steps.headline: Screw on either the tripod head or bracket, and add your camera.

tyn: Bench top vise (steel construction is better)
Old or cheap tripod (you need the head of it)
text: Have the tripod head for your focusing rail. You will want something like a ball head that you would attach to a tripod. This is not a quick release attachment. That will not work. Get your vise. You can find these at your local garden and construction supply store; a place like Lowe's or Home Depot (US). It will be something along the lines of a 4 inch (10.2 cm) vise. Determine the exact physical center of the vise. This makes it easier to get a 360 degree of movement and improves its range of motion. Mark it with whatever you have for reference. Drill a hole through the base of the vise. This is where you are going to attach the tripod head. Fasten your tripod head that you are going to use.  Drill a hole through the base of the vise and through the metal plate on the top. If you need to, take apart the vise. Be sure that the hole will be big enough for the stud to fit through.  Screw the drill into place. You may want to add some type of metal adhesive. Or, if you are good with tools, use a soldering tool around where the stud meets the metal of the bench top vise. This will provide for a more secure connection than just adhesive. Screw on either the tripod head or bracket, and add your camera.
